slo.name: User API Availability
slo.description: Ensure the user-api service is available 99.95% of the time

sli.name: Request Success Rate
sli.description: Percentage of total requests that are successful

sli.name: User API Request Latency
sli.description: Average response time for a successful request

alerts.name: User API High Request Latency
alerts.description: Trigger an alert if the average response time exceeds 500 milliseconds for more than 5 minutes.

explanation: The User API service has two key metrics: Request Success Rate and Request Latency. The Request Success Rate SLO ensures the service is available 99.95% of the time, while the Request Latency SLI measures the average response time for successful requests. An alert rule has been set up to trigger if the average response time exceeds 500 milliseconds for more than 5 minutes.
llm_suggestions: Consider adding more logging to better understand error cases in the Request Success Rate SLO calculation
Monitor and alert on additional relevant metrics, such as error rates or failed requests, to further improve service reliability
